div.span: Adapted from Inventory of Greek Coin Hoards

div.pre: 2130 Licata (anc. Phintias), 1926 (618) Burial: c. 350-340 B.C. (Jenkins) Contents: 91 AR Rhegium: 1 tetradr. Gela: 4 tetradr. Leontini: 2 tetradr. Messana: 1 tetradr. Selinus: 1 tetradr. Syracuse: 3 tetradr. Athens: 4 tetradr. (2 5th cent.; 2 4th) Pegasi Corinth: 54 (51) (Ravel Per. IV; 1 of Per. V with Ε) Ambracia: 4 (5) (to Ravel 110) Corcyra: 2 Dyrrhachium: 2 Leucas: 13 (14) (ΛΕϒ issues, some with caduceus) Unc.: 1 (Potidaea) Disposition: Syracuse (totals in parentheses are those of Jenkins, Gela) Currò Pisanò AIIN 1962-4, pp. 226, 238 Jenkins, ANSCent., p. 375; Gela, p. 153 Jenkins lists 1 Himera in place of 1 Selinus of Currò
